intro: Eriosema bauchiense, commonly known as the Bauchi eriosema, is a flowering plant native to Nigeria. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive foliage and floral structure. The plant features trifoliate leaves with hairy surfaces, giving it a velvety texture. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, often in racemose inflorescences, and display a range of colors from white to pale yellow. Eriosema bauchiense is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun exposure.
